review: Sluggish, freezes, loses connection every day and has to be restarted (unplugged) to find a signal again.  The only good spot is:  unlike its counter part the fire tv box the remote with the fire stick actually works and doesn't give out in 2 weeks.  I planned on getting one as a gift but will be going with another brand until amazon "gets it together".  I love amazon and most that they offer and was very sad and disappointed with this device.  I have prime and thought this would be a nice way to view everything in one place.........I was wrong.
author: Ashley Tomey

review: Has been a great streaming device for hotel use. Home use thru my receiver (everything I have goes thru this...PS3, Apple TV, DVR, Wii-U) is a different story though. It's very spotty in getting it to work thru my Onkyo receiver. I seem to have to hit the home button (or any other buttons) several times until after nearly 90-120 seconds before it comes on. That's a pretty annoying amount of time to wait for it to come on and I haven't been able to find a good answer on why that is yet (perhaps someone can enlighten me). Maybe it's only meant to work direct with an HDTV, yet all my other devices respond and startup very quickly. Since I can get it to work eventually, I'm not convinced it's my setup, otherwise it wouldn't work at all. So, I rely on the PS3 and Apple TV for my streaming needs. This is really only useful for me while travelling in a hotel. Another thing....I stream Amazon Prime music to my phone, for which I've created a few playlists. Only one of the playlists is visible on the Fire Stick. I have no clue what I need to do get the others to appear. Don't even know what I did to get one of them to appear.
